title: TeraLab to Host a Special Session on HPC and Genomics @ CIBB 2025
description:
As part of the upcoming CIBB 2025 – Computational Intelligence Methods for Bioinformatics and Biostatistics conference, to be held in Milan from September 10–12, 2025, TeraLab will organize a Special Session entitled:

High-Performance Computing for AI-driven Genomics

The session will focus on the intersection of high-performance computing, deep learning, and large-scale genomic data analysis. Topics include:

  • · modeling and analysis of large genomic datasets
  • · optimization of computational pipelines using HPC and GPU-based infrastructures
  • · application of deep learning models to complex biological problems

The session aims to foster discussion and collaboration among researchers working on advanced computational methods for genomics, with particular attention to scalability, efficiency, and innovation.

title: 21st Conference on Computational Intelligence Methods for Bioinformatics and Biostatistics @ La Sapienza
description:
We are pleased to announce that TeraLab, part of the Dipartimento di Scienze Statistiche - Università di Roma "La Sapienza", will organize the 21st Conference on Computational Intelligence Methods for Bioinformatics and Biostatistics.

The event will take place from September 2–4, 2026, at Sapienza Università di Roma, bringing together leading researchers in bioinformatics, biostatistics, artificial intelligence, computational biology, and data-intensive life sciences.

CIBB 2026 will offer a multidisciplinary platform for scientific exchange, featuring keynote lectures, special sessions, and peer-reviewed contributions on innovative computational methods applied to biological and medical data.

We look forward to hosting a vibrant community of scholars and fostering new collaborations at Sapienza.
